newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia decision soon on chicken imports.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia decision soon on chicken imports.

text.p: The Australian government on Tuesday said it would decide soon on whether to allow cooked chicken meat imports, in the face of opposition from the domestic industry.
Primary Industries Minister John Anderson said two committees were looking at the issue.
"Their considerations will be taken on board and worked through by the government," he told parliament.
But he said he saw no reason to change the former Labor government's decision to allow imports.
Australia's A$2.0 billion poulty industry, fearing the loss of a substantial market share, is fighting moves to allow imports of cooked chicken meat.
The move to open the market follows pressure from the United States, Thailand and Denmark.
